title: Analysis of Chemical Learning Communication Patterns: Mathematical Pedagogy Design Based on TBLA

context.prior_knowledge: Advanced-level expertise and extensive practical experience in the field, basic statistical and data analysis skills
context.additional_context: Targeting learners from medical, legal, and technical fields seeking to apply foundational chemistry knowledge to practice. Focus is on interpreting communication patterns using mathematical analysis techniques.

learning_goals: By combining the TBLA (Task-Based Language Analysis) technique with mathematical modeling, it is possible to quantitatively analyze teacher-student communication patterns that occur during chemistry classes.

The quality of classroom interaction is evaluated through keyword frequency analysis (statistical analysis) and speech volume analysis (probabilistic modeling) based on the transcribed text of recorded lecture materials.
Derive concrete insights for improving instructional design and identify mathematical patterns by presenting analytical results through graphs and visualization tools (schematic diagrams).
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
